a8d8a17c-e920-497c-abb2-aac0cef1cb31 Halve artichokes lengthwise. Remove and discard center petals and fizzy center; set artichokes aside.
a8d8a17c-e920-497c-abb2-aac0cef1cb31 Cook pasta until done but slightly firm, rinse and set aside.
a8d8a17c-e920-497c-abb2-aac0cef1cb31 In a medium bowl, whisk together dressing ingredients.
a8d8a17c-e920-497c-abb2-aac0cef1cb31 In a large bowl combine pasta, cucumber, carrots, radishes, green onions, and snow peas.
a8d8a17c-e920-497c-abb2-aac0cef1cb31 Toss noodle mixture with HALF of the dressing; reserve the remaining half.
a8d8a17c-e920-497c-abb2-aac0cef1cb31 Arrange two artichoke halves on each plate. Spoon noodles into halves.
a8d8a17c-e920-497c-abb2-aac0cef1cb31 Use reserve dressing as dip for artichoke leaves. Serve immediately.
38c818c4-222b-43a3-90f6-f3d21c92ddb3 Prepare and cook artichokes as directed for Whole Artichokes (see Basic Preparation).
38c818c4-222b-43a3-90f6-f3d21c92ddb3 Brown Canadian bacon slices in skillet.
38c818c4-222b-43a3-90f6-f3d21c92ddb3 Poach eggs in boiling, salted water.
38c818c4-222b-43a3-90f6-f3d21c92ddb3 Spread leaves of artichoke open like flower petals.
38c818c4-222b-43a3-90f6-f3d21c92ddb3 Remove center petals and fuzzy centers from artichokes and discard.
38c818c4-222b-43a3-90f6-f3d21c92ddb3 Place bacon slices into artichoke centers, covering bottom, and top with poached eggs.
38c818c4-222b-43a3-90f6-f3d21c92ddb3 Spoon on Hollandaise Sauce and serve immediately.
38c818c4-222b-43a3-90f6-f3d21c92ddb3 In small saucepan, heat together egg yolks, water and lemon juice.
38c818c4-222b-43a3-90f6-f3d21c92ddb3 Cook over very low heat, stirring constantly, until yolk mixture bubbles at edges.
38c818c4-222b-43a3-90f6-f3d21c92ddb3 Stir in butter, 1 piece at a time, until melted and sauce is thickened.
38c818c4-222b-43a3-90f6-f3d21c92ddb3 Stir paprika, red pepper and salt to taste.
38c818c4-222b-43a3-90f6-f3d21c92ddb3 Remove from heat. Serve warm.
38c818c4-222b-43a3-90f6-f3d21c92ddb3 Cover and chill if not used immediately.
ce3ecac5-3f51-442e-a09a-1c5546efae3d Prepare artichokes: bend back outer petals until they snap off easily near base; continue to snap off petals until leaves are half green at top and half yellow. Slice off green portion of leaves.
ce3ecac5-3f51-442e-a09a-1c5546efae3d Cut the stem level with the base and trim any remaining dark green from the base then cut artichokes in half.
ce3ecac5-3f51-442e-a09a-1c5546efae3d Cut out any purple or pink inner leaves. If the interior is white, the entire artichoke is edible.
ce3ecac5-3f51-442e-a09a-1c5546efae3d In a large pan bring water, lemon juice, carrot, celery and peppercorns to a boil.
ce3ecac5-3f51-442e-a09a-1c5546efae3d Add artichokes and cook until tender, about 7 to 10 minutes, remove artichokes from liquid and cool.
ce3ecac5-3f51-442e-a09a-1c5546efae3d Cook pasta in boiling water until al dente; rinse in cold water and drain.
ce3ecac5-3f51-442e-a09a-1c5546efae3d Toss with 1 tablespoon of olive oil; set aside.
ce3ecac5-3f51-442e-a09a-1c5546efae3d Beat eggs with heavy cream, Parmesan cheese, basil, garlic, salt and pepper. Stir in cooked artichokes, pasta, tomato and sautéed mushrooms.
ce3ecac5-3f51-442e-a09a-1c5546efae3d Heat remaining 2 tablespoons olive oil in large skillet. Pour in egg mixture. Cook on one side until golden brown and turn to brown second side.
ce3ecac5-3f51-442e-a09a-1c5546efae3d Cut into 4 wedges. Garnish with fresh herbs, as desired.

ce3ecac5-3f51-442e-a09a-1c5546efae3d Cut the stem level with the base and trim any remaining dark green from the base then cut artichokes in half.
ce3ecac5-3f51-442e-a09a-1c5546efae3d Cut out any purple or pink inner leaves. If the interior is white, the entire artichoke is edible.

ce3ecac5-3f51-442e-a09a-1c5546efae3d Add artichokes and cook until tender, about 7 to 10 minutes, remove artichokes from liquid and cool.

ebfdc826-05d9-45ca-b697-9b41ea6a78ba Halve artichokes lengthwise. Remove and discard center petals and fuzzy center. Remove outer leaves of artichokes and reserve. Trim out hearts and chop finely; set aside.
ebfdc826-05d9-45ca-b697-9b41ea6a78ba Pour boiling water over tomatoes and let stand for 3 minutes until softened; drain and set aside.
ebfdc826-05d9-45ca-b697-9b41ea6a78ba Simmer eggplant in chicken broth for 10 minutes; drain well.
ebfdc826-05d9-45ca-b697-9b41ea6a78ba In blender or food processor, place tomatoes, drained eggplant, onion, herbs, garlic, salt and pepper. Cover and process until nearly smooth.
ebfdc826-05d9-45ca-b697-9b41ea6a78ba Stir in chopped artichoke hearts.
ebfdc826-05d9-45ca-b697-9b41ea6a78ba Halve artichokes lengthwise. Remove and discard center petals and fuzzy center. Remove outer leaves of artichokes and reserve. Trim out hearts and chop finely; set aside.
ebfdc826-05d9-45ca-b697-9b41ea6a78ba Pour boiling water over tomatoes and let stand for 3 minutes until softened; drain and set aside.
ebfdc826-05d9-45ca-b697-9b41ea6a78ba Simmer eggplant in chicken broth for 10 minutes; drain well.
ebfdc826-05d9-45ca-b697-9b41ea6a78ba In blender or food processor, place tomatoes, drained eggplant, onion, herbs, garlic, salt and pepper. Cover and process until nearly smooth.
ebfdc826-05d9-45ca-b697-9b41ea6a78ba Stir in chopped artichoke hearts.
ebfdc826-05d9-45ca-b697-9b41ea6a78ba Arrange artichoke leaves on a serving platter.
ebfdc826-05d9-45ca-b697-9b41ea6a78ba Spoon 1 tsp of of the eggplant mixture onto the wide end of artichoke leaves. Garnish with a fresh herb leaf, if desired.
ebfdc826-05d9-45ca-b697-9b41ea6a78ba Arrange artichoke leaves on platter, surrounding a bowl of the eggplant mixtures.
ebfdc826-05d9-45ca-b697-9b41ea6a78ba Use artichoke leaves to scoop up individual servings of the dip. Dip can be prepared up to 24 hours ahead and chilled until serving time.
318c9469-f92a-4523-86a7-f3e7bdd9f0a0 Cut off stems and snap off first few small leaves. Slice through tips, if desired. Trim dark green from bottom.
318c9469-f92a-4523-86a7-f3e7bdd9f0a0 Plunge into acidified water to prevent discoloration.
318c9469-f92a-4523-86a7-f3e7bdd9f0a0 Cook by preferred method. Drain.
318c9469-f92a-4523-86a7-f3e7bdd9f0a0 Separate leaves from bottom, discarding any purple or thorny center leaves; set aside. Remove fuzzy center from bottom; set aside.
318c9469-f92a-4523-86a7-f3e7bdd9f0a0 Trim sweet anise; slice thinly.
318c9469-f92a-4523-86a7-f3e7bdd9f0a0 Combine olive oil and lemon juice in a non-reactive pan.
318c9469-f92a-4523-86a7-f3e7bdd9f0a0 Braise sweet anise, tightly covered, over low heat, stirring occasionally, until very tender for about 30 minutes.
318c9469-f92a-4523-86a7-f3e7bdd9f0a0 Arrange prepared artichoke bottoms on top of braising sweet anise.
318c9469-f92a-4523-86a7-f3e7bdd9f0a0 Cover; heat artichokes through, about 5 to 10 minutes.
318c9469-f92a-4523-86a7-f3e7bdd9f0a0 Add a tablespoon of water, as needed to keep food moist.
318c9469-f92a-4523-86a7-f3e7bdd9f0a0 Remove artichoke bottoms from pan. Hold warm.
318c9469-f92a-4523-86a7-f3e7bdd9f0a0 In a food processor or blender, puree the cooked sweet anise, chick peas, salt, pepper, and cayenne.
318c9469-f92a-4523-86a7-f3e7bdd9f0a0 Fill center of cooked artichoke bottom with a few tablespoons of the chick pea puree. Arrange cooked artichoke leaves around center.
42913a74-b802-4325-8066-7f2573b1e0cd Trim all the dark green parts from the artichokes leaving the base and the inner, light green leaves.
42913a74-b802-4325-8066-7f2573b1e0cd Slice top of leaves to about 1/2 inch above base. Cut the stem level with the base.
42913a74-b802-4325-8066-7f2573b1e0cd Cook artichokes in boiling salted water with the lemon and garlic until tender, about 20 to 25 minutes. Remove from water and cool.
42913a74-b802-4325-8066-7f2573b1e0cd Remove tender yellow leaves from artichokes; set aside. Remove and discard any purple leaves or fuzz from the center of artichokes.
42913a74-b802-4325-8066-7f2573b1e0cd Slice the artichoke bottoms crosswise into three even disks.
42913a74-b802-4325-8066-7f2573b1e0cd Salt and pepper artichoke disks and the reserved leaves; dredge in flour.
42913a74-b802-4325-8066-7f2573b1e0cd In skillet, cook artichoke disks and leaves in hot butter or oil until golden brown. Remove from skillet and drain on paper towels.
42913a74-b802-4325-8066-7f2573b1e0cd Place an artichoke disk on plate; top with layer of Mushroom Duxelle.
42913a74-b802-4325-8066-7f2573b1e0cd Add another artichoke disk, another layer of Mushroom Duxelle, and top with final artichoke disk.
42913a74-b802-4325-8066-7f2573b1e0cd Place one stack on each plate for an appetizer or three stacks for main dish.
42913a74-b802-4325-8066-7f2573b1e0cd Surround stack(s) with Tomato Coulis and garnish with browned artichoke leaves, chives, lemon zest and fluted mushroom cap, as desired.
42913a74-b802-4325-8066-7f2573b1e0cd Finely chop mushrooms with a knife.
42913a74-b802-4325-8066-7f2573b1e0cd Heat butter in large skillet, add shallots and garlic; cook two minutes.
42913a74-b802-4325-8066-7f2573b1e0cd Add chopped mushrooms.
42913a74-b802-4325-8066-7f2573b1e0cd Cook over high heat until dry. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Stir in truffle oil.
42913a74-b802-4325-8066-7f2573b1e0cd In a nonreactive saucepan, heat butter.
42913a74-b802-4325-8066-7f2573b1e0cd Add shallots and garlic; cook two minutes.
42913a74-b802-4325-8066-7f2573b1e0cd Add wine and tomatoes. Boil rapidly until tomatoes are soft.
42913a74-b802-4325-8066-7f2573b1e0cd Puree mixture and press through sieve. Return mixture to saucepan and reduce to approximately 5 cups or until mixture coats a spoon. Season to taste.
f0d7b401-d9c1-4503-8e98-77146ee68087 Wash artichokes; remove outer leaves until pale yellow leaves are exposed.
f0d7b401-d9c1-4503-8e98-77146ee68087 Cut off top two inches and stems so artichokes will sit upright. Remove fuzzy centers and rub all surfaces with half of lemon.
f0d7b401-d9c1-4503-8e98-77146ee68087 Add juice of remaining lemon to water and dip artichokes to preserve green color.
f0d7b401-d9c1-4503-8e98-77146ee68087 Mix mint and garlic with ¼ cup olive oil and spoon into hollows of artichokes.
f0d7b401-d9c1-4503-8e98-77146ee68087 Place in pan just large enough to hold them upright.
f0d7b401-d9c1-4503-8e98-77146ee68087 Add water to depth of three inches, remaining olive oil and salt to taste.
f0d7b401-d9c1-4503-8e98-77146ee68087 Bring to a boil. Reduce heat, cover and simmer 25 minutes or until just tender. Cooking will vary with size of artichokes.
f0d7b401-d9c1-4503-8e98-77146ee68087 Remove artichokes, drain and hold warm.
f0d7b401-d9c1-4503-8e98-77146ee68087 Reduce cooking liquid until of a syrupy consistency. Spoon sauce over artichokes and serve.

fc07753d-1944-4c6e-949c-49ec80242193 Trim brown end of stem and cut off top 2-inches of artichokes; discard.
fc07753d-1944-4c6e-949c-49ec80242193 Pare outer dark green surface layer from artichoke bottoms. Cut out center petals and fuzzy centers.
fc07753d-1944-4c6e-949c-49ec80242193 Slice artichoke bottoms about ¼-inch thick. Toss with lemon juice to prevent discoloration; set aside.
fc07753d-1944-4c6e-949c-49ec80242193 Sauté onions in olive oil 5 to 8 minutes or until tender.
fc07753d-1944-4c6e-949c-49ec80242193 Spoon evenly into 2-quart oven-proof baking dish. Sprinkle with Italian herb seasoning.
fc07753d-1944-4c6e-949c-49ec80242193 Arrange tomato slices, artichoke slices and cheese slices on onions, over-lapping slightly in center of dish.
fc07753d-1944-4c6e-949c-49ec80242193 Cover dish with lid or foil. Bake at 375°F for 40 minutes.
838cf706-c245-428e-afd4-d09fed1e0181 Wash artichokes, cut off stems at base and remove small bottom leaves.
838cf706-c245-428e-afd4-d09fed1e0181 Stand artichokes upright in deep saucepan large enough to hold snugly. Add 1 teaspoon salt and 2 to 3 inches boiling water.
838cf706-c245-428e-afd4-d09fed1e0181 Cover and boil gently 35 to 45 minutes, or until base can be pierced easily with fork. (Add a little more boiling water, if needed.)
838cf706-c245-428e-afd4-d09fed1e0181 Turn artichokes upside down to drain. Carefully remove center petals and fuzzy centers with a spoon and discard. Keep warm or chill as desired.
838cf706-c245-428e-afd4-d09fed1e0181 In medium saucepan combine chicken broth, curry powder, cumin and garlic salt; bring to a boil. Remove from heat; stir in couscous and currants. Cover and let stand 5 minutes.
838cf706-c245-428e-afd4-d09fed1e0181 Fluff couscous with a fork. Stir in green onion and almonds. Combine lemon peel, lemon juice and vegetable oil; stir into couscous.
838cf706-c245-428e-afd4-d09fed1e0181 Gently spread artichoke leaves until center cone of leaves is revealed. Pull out center cone. With a spoon, scrape out any purple-tipped leaves and fuzz.
838cf706-c245-428e-afd4-d09fed1e0181 Fill centers of artichokes with couscous mixture. Serve with plain yogurt, if desired.
d925a7cd-00a6-46f2-877b-7571f09b2fbf Wash artichokes under cold running water, cut off stems at base and remove small bottom leaves.
d925a7cd-00a6-46f2-877b-7571f09b2fbf Cut off top quarter of artichokes; discard.
d925a7cd-00a6-46f2-877b-7571f09b2fbf Spread leaves, remove center leaves and fuzzy centers with a spoon and discard.
d925a7cd-00a6-46f2-877b-7571f09b2fbf Toss bread crumbs with cheese, olive oil, garlic, parsley, oregano, salt and pepper to taste.
d925a7cd-00a6-46f2-877b-7571f09b2fbf Stuff bread crumb mixture between leaves of artichokes and fill centers. Place stuffed artichokes in a 9-inch square baking dish.
d925a7cd-00a6-46f2-877b-7571f09b2fbf Pour 2 cups boiling water around the artichokes. Cover with lid or foil.
d925a7cd-00a6-46f2-877b-7571f09b2fbf Bake at 350 degrees F. for 40 minutes or until artichokes are tender.
d925a7cd-00a6-46f2-877b-7571f09b2fbf Remove artichokes from baking dish and place on rack; cool to room temperature.
1c352bf5-660d-4b37-9b12-855fecf99a24 Heat shortening to 350°F.
1c352bf5-660d-4b37-9b12-855fecf99a24 Mix together the batter mix, baking powder, water and beer.
1c352bf5-660d-4b37-9b12-855fecf99a24 Dip artichokes in batter mix, then roll in bread crumbs mixed with Parmesan cheese.
1c352bf5-660d-4b37-9b12-855fecf99a24 Fry 2 or 3 minutes or until light golden brown. *For preparation of baby artichokes, see the directions and photos under Basic Preparation. Trim to hearts, quarter, and place in water with lemon juice to prevent browning. Drain well before dipping in batter.
1053aaab-08de-4260-ab23-c6b464186bcc Slice artichoke tops off, crosswise. Trim Stems.
1053aaab-08de-4260-ab23-c6b464186bcc Boil or steam artichokes until bottoms pierce easily, or a petal pulls off easily.
1053aaab-08de-4260-ab23-c6b464186bcc Drain artichokes. Cool.
1053aaab-08de-4260-ab23-c6b464186bcc Cut each artichoke in half lengthwise and scrape out fuzzy center and any purple tipped petals.
1053aaab-08de-4260-ab23-c6b464186bcc Mix remaining ingredients in a large plastic bag. Place artichokes in the bag and coat all sides of the artichokes. For best flavor marinate in the mixture overnight in the refrigerator but should marinate at least one hour.
1053aaab-08de-4260-ab23-c6b464186bcc Drain artichokes.
1053aaab-08de-4260-ab23-c6b464186bcc Place cut side down on a grill over a solid bed of medium coals or gas grill on medium. Grill until lightly browned on the cut side, 5 to 7 minutes. Turn artichokes over and drizzle some of the remaining marinade over the artichokes.
1053aaab-08de-4260-ab23-c6b464186bcc Grill until petal tips are lightly charred, 3 to 4 minutes more.
1053aaab-08de-4260-ab23-c6b464186bcc Serve hot or room temperature
a217e4c2-4870-416d-bac1-f369d927da93 In a saucepan, simmer rice in broth about 20 minutes or until tender.
a217e4c2-4870-416d-bac1-f369d927da93 Remove petals and fuzzy centers from cooked artichokes; cut bottoms into ¼ inch dice.
a217e4c2-4870-416d-bac1-f369d927da93 When rice is done, add diced artichokes to broth.
a217e4c2-4870-416d-bac1-f369d927da93 Beat together eggs and lemon juice.
a217e4c2-4870-416d-bac1-f369d927da93 Slowly whisk ⅓ of hot broth mixture into egg mixture, then pour back into saucepan, whisking constantly.
a217e4c2-4870-416d-bac1-f369d927da93 Cook over low heat, stirring constantly, until soup thickens slightly. DO NOT BOIL ONCE EGGS HAVE BEEN ADDED OR SOUP WILL SEPARATE.
a217e4c2-4870-416d-bac1-f369d927da93 Season with salt and pepper and more lemon juice, if desired.
a217e4c2-4870-416d-bac1-f369d927da93 In a saucepan, simmer rice in broth about 20 minutes or until tender.
a217e4c2-4870-416d-bac1-f369d927da93 Remove petals and fuzzy centers from cooked artichokes; cut bottoms into ¼ inch dice.
a217e4c2-4870-416d-bac1-f369d927da93 When rice is done, add diced artichokes to broth.
a217e4c2-4870-416d-bac1-f369d927da93 Beat together eggs and lemon juice.
a217e4c2-4870-416d-bac1-f369d927da93 Slowly whisk ⅓ of hot broth mixture into egg mixture, then pour back into saucepan, whisking constantly.
a217e4c2-4870-416d-bac1-f369d927da93 Cook over low heat, stirring constantly, until soup thickens slightly. DO NOT BOIL ONCE EGGS HAVE BEEN ADDED OR SOUP WILL SEPARATE.
a217e4c2-4870-416d-bac1-f369d927da93 Season with salt and pepper and more lemon juice, if desired.
7740cde0-9434-4508-8b01-c890e40a67b3 Saute onions, almonds and cilantro in olive oil until almonds are browned
7740cde0-9434-4508-8b01-c890e40a67b3 Add cooked pasta, turkey, lime juice, salt and pepper
7740cde0-9434-4508-8b01-c890e40a67b3 Cook and toss until thoroughly heated
7740cde0-9434-4508-8b01-c890e40a67b3 Carefully remove center cone of artichoke petals and scrape out fuzz with a small spoon (see Basic Preparation)
7740cde0-9434-4508-8b01-c890e40a67b3 Fill artichokes with pasta mixture
7740cde0-9434-4508-8b01-c890e40a67b3 Spoon fresh salsa on pasta filling and between petals of artichokes
7740cde0-9434-4508-8b01-c890e40a67b3 Trim stems so artichokes stand upright
7740cde0-9434-4508-8b01-c890e40a67b3 Cut ¼ to â…“ off tops of artichokes
7740cde0-9434-4508-8b01-c890e40a67b3 Stand prepared artichokes in deep saucepan or pot with 3 inches boiling water
7740cde0-9434-4508-8b01-c890e40a67b3 If desired, oil, lemon juice and seasoning can be added to cooking water
7740cde0-9434-4508-8b01-c890e40a67b3 Cover and boil gently 25 to 40 minutes, depending on size, or until a petal near the center pulls out easily
7740cde0-9434-4508-8b01-c890e40a67b3 Preparation time: about 45 minutes
91df07f8-9688-437a-95d7-4d29234b529e Halve cooked artichokes lengthwise; scoop out center petals and fuzzy centers. Remove outer leaves and reserve to garnish salad; or refrigerate to use for snacks another time. Thinly slice hearts. Cover; set aside.
91df07f8-9688-437a-95d7-4d29234b529e Place whole bell peppers under preheated broiler; broil under high heat until charred on all sides, turning frequently with tongs. Carefully remove from oven with tongs; place in a paper bag for 15 minutes to steam skins. Carefully remove peppers from bag; remove seeds and ribs. Strip off skins; slice peppers into julienne strips.
91df07f8-9688-437a-95d7-4d29234b529e Prepare Dressing: In blender or food processor container, place ¼ of the bell pepper strips, vinegars, garlic, basil, rosemary and sugar. Cover and process until well blended and nearly smooth.
91df07f8-9688-437a-95d7-4d29234b529e Assemble Salads: Arrange reserved cooked artichoke leaves or lettuce leaves on 8 salad plates. Arrange sliced artichoke hearts, remaining ¾ of the bell pepper strips, red onion and olive slices on artichoke or lettuce leaves.
91df07f8-9688-437a-95d7-4d29234b529e Spoon dressing over salads.
91df07f8-9688-437a-95d7-4d29234b529e Halve cooked artichokes lengthwise; scoop out center petals and fuzzy centers. Remove outer leaves and reserve to garnish salad; or refrigerate to use for snacks another time. Thinly slice hearts. Cover; set aside.
